title: Cat. 87  Young Maoris, 1896/97
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Young Maoris  
1896/97  
Wood-block print printed twice in yellow ocher and black ink, on cream wove notebook paper ruled in blue; 88 × 107 mm (image/sheet)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of the Print and Drawing Club, 1952.136  
Guérin 54, Kornfeld 39  
For the verso, see fig. 87.1

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">From the artist to Georges-Daniel de Monfreid (1856–1929), by the winter of 1896–97.

By descent to his son-in-law, Louis Huc (born 1890), by 1931.

Sold by Gerald Cramer (1916–1991), Geneva, to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1952.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Paris, Galerie de la Pléiade, Gauguin: Oeuvre gravé, May 26–June 14, 1931, cat. 30.

Art Institute of Chicago, Gauguin: Paintings, Drawings, Prints, Sculpture, Feb. 12–Mar. 29, 1959, cat. 174; New York, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Apr. 21–May 31, 1959.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Henri M. Petiet, Gauguin: Oeuvre gravé, exh. cat. (Éd. de la Pléiade, 1931), cat. 30.

Marcel Guérin, L’oeuvre gravé de Gauguin (H. Floury, 1927; Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1980), cat. 54 (ill.).

Art Institute of Chicago and Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York, Gauguin: Paintings, Drawings, Prints, Sculpture, exh. cat. (Art Institute of Chicago, 1959), p. 87, cat. 174.

Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine H. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 162, cat. 39.

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">Gauguin sent this woodcut from Tahiti to Monfreid in the winter of 1896–97, according to Marcel Guérin in Guérin, L’oeuvre gravé de Gauguin (H. Floury, 1927; rev. ed., Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1980), cat. 53.

According to the catalogue for the exhibition organized by Henri Petiet in 1931 at Galerie de la Pléiade in Paris, this woodcut, along with two others now in the collection of the Art Institute of Chicago (cat. 86 and 88), were lent by Mr. Louis Huc, son-in-law of Georges-Daniel de Monfreid. Henri M. Petiet, Gauguin: Oeuvre gravé, exh. cat. (Éd. de la Pléiade, 1931), n.pag. Monfreid was in attendance when Huc married Agnès de Monfreid in 1917. Aude Pessey-Lux and Jean Lepage, eds., George-Daniel de Monfreid (1856–1929): Le confident de Gauguin (Somogy, 2003), p. 12.

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 87 Young Maoris, 1896/97.

fig. 87.1 Verso of Gauguin’s Young Maoris, 1896/97. The Art Institute of Chicago, 1952.136.

</section>
